You're tempting it nfm, and that's not a good thing.

But if you really, absolutely must have something, and it's not available as a deb, or as source, then you can use alien. But most likely the package won't install properly and you have to spend some manner of time running around in a massive terminal FUBAR and removeing stuff by hand.
Not really explode, just force you to have fun with a recovery shell because rpm just got root and decided to add random stuff to things.

Because if it's just one program in a terminal, it's better to just use alias.

Just open .bashrc, and on the last line, add "alias adb='<path to program>/<program name>'"
